awd_titl_txt: Statistical Mechanics and Dynamics of Disordered Systems
awd_abstract_narration: The statistical mechanics and dynamics of disordered systems will               be investigated using analytical and numerical methods.  Three                  major areas will be studied:  1)  Self-avoiding walks in random                 environments, 2) The superfluid transition for Helium in porous                 media and 3) Random resistor and elastic networks.  These topics                will be investigated by a variety of modern methods of                          statistical mechanics; including field theory and the                           renormalization group, Lifshitz type arguments, and numerical                   simulation.  This research is directly relevant to understanding                current experiments in the areas of superfluids in porous glasses               and polymers in gels.  A second fundamental objective of this                   work is to advance the development of theoretical tools for the                 study of disordered systems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
